AD_Bird.synopsis: A few ADs for the bird on the approach to the Monastery, to draw the eye.

Bird_SWA.synopsis: While approaching the gith creche, climbing on a mountain, The player talks to a bird sitting in its nest. It's been bullied by the eagles on the roof, and if scared away it has a nest full of baked goods.
Bird_SWA.how_to_trigger: Take the alternative path to the monastery (no cable car), and just past the loot across the wooden bridge sits a hungry bluejay. Click on CRE_Bird_c85a9bab-49d6-476b-a07b-15e920c3cc24

automatic_ordering.reasoning: Both sessions involve a bird encounter near the Monastery, but they are triggered by taking different routes. 'AD_Bird' is activated when approaching the monastery on the main path (as indicated by its coordinate-based trigger), while 'Bird_SWA' is specifically triggered when taking the alternative path (without the cable car) and encountering the bluejay near the wooden bridge. Since a player’s choice of route determines which encounter happens, these two sessions are mutually exclusive. There is no clear causal or sequential dependency between them beyond being alternative paths, so no ordering constraints are needed.

Bird_SWA_11.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_11.text: Glorious! Feathers bloody everywhere, mate! Feels good to be home in my nest.

Bird_SWA_41.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_41.text: I wish there was something I could give you in return. Oh! Tell you what...

Bird_SWA_112.speaker: Player
Bird_SWA_112.text: Who said it's your nest? I killed the eagles. It's mine.

Bird_SWA_76.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_76.text: Why do you want it? You lot don't even lay eggs! Let me have it - I'll make it worth your while.

Bird_SWA_92.speaker: Player
Bird_SWA_92.text: Fine. What do you have for me?

Bird_SWA_40.speaker: Player
Bird_SWA_40.text: Actually, my kind do birth eggs.

Bird_SWA_56.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_56.text: Weird. Does your kind like mysterious buried treasure more than bullying birds?

Bird_SWA_46.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_46.text: Bet these eagle corpses'll scare any more of the big-wing bastards away.

Bird_SWA_55.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_55.text: Let me guess. Defeat. It's to be expected, eagles are invincible after all.

Bird_SWA_43.speaker: Player
Bird_SWA_43.text: They're not invincible, I just haven't gotten round to it yet.

Bird_SWA_63.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_63.text: Typical arrogance. Remember, tall one, pride comes before the fall. A very long fall.

Bird_SWA_94.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_94.text: I've got nothing left to take, so you might as well shove off!

Bird_SWA_83.speaker: Player
Bird_SWA_83.text: Did someone steal something from you?

Bird_SWA_29.speaker: Player
Bird_SWA_29.text: That's a lot of attitude from a little bird.

Bird_SWA_53.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_53.text: Maybe I wouldn't be so little if I had a proper dinner and a nest.

Bird_SWA_14.speaker: Player
Bird_SWA_14.text: Is that why you're grumpy then? You're hungry?

Bird_SWA_8.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_8.text: I'm not just hungry! But, also, yes. I am hungry.

Bird_SWA_96.speaker: Player
Bird_SWA_96.text: Is there not enough food around here?

Bird_SWA_3.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_3.text: Not since the bloody eagles turned up and turfed me out of my first nest.

Bird_SWA_17.speaker: Player
Bird_SWA_17.text: So am I, and you look like a perfect portion.

Bird_SWA_47.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_47.text: Hah! The eagles couldn't finish me off, and they're much bigger than you.

Bird_SWA_73.speaker: Player
Bird_SWA_73.text: I'm not here to take. I'm looking for a githyanki crèche. Have you seen one?

Bird_SWA_93.speaker: Player
Bird_SWA_93.text: I'm not here to take - just exploring. Seen anything interesting?

Bird_SWA_19.speaker: Player
Bird_SWA_19.text: I'm not here to take. Have you seen any of my people nearby?

Bird_SWA_2.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_2.text: Do I look like a bloody tour guide?

Bird_SWA_113.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_113.text: All I know is the roof's the best nest-spot on the whole Chionthar. I got there first, too. Before the thieves showed up.

Bird_SWA_80.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_80.text: Steal? Eagles are bigger, they just take... Nest, prey, everything. That's how it works here.

Bird_SWA_62.speaker: Player
Bird_SWA_62.text: I can't help but notice you have a nest right there.

Bird_SWA_26.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_26.text: Oh, sure, a nest. But it's not my nest. That's up on the roof, with the eagles. Eagles are pricks.
Bird_SWA_26.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player sees a shot of the roof in the distance. NodeContext: "my nest" said with a deep longing

Bird_SWA_87.speaker: Player
Bird_SWA_87.text: I've already killed the eagles, luckily for you.

Bird_SWA_22.speaker: Player
Bird_SWA_22.text: I can fight the eagles and get your nest back.

Bird_SWA_34.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_34.text: It's a good lookout spot for food...
Bird_SWA_34.context: NodeContext: Food emphasised like something heavenly

Bird_SWA_49.speaker: Player
Bird_SWA_49.text: Wait, so if that's not your nest, whose is it?

Bird_SWA_78.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_78.text: Some poor little tit who wasn't paying attention.

Bird_SWA_16.speaker: Player
Bird_SWA_16.text: So the eagles are pricks for stealing a nest, but you're not?

Bird_SWA_28.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_28.text: Exactly right. Not all humans can grasp bird ethics, you should be proud.

Bird_SWA_75.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_75.text: It's not even like the eagles need my nest, the drunk lizards they eat aren't hard to catch.

Bird_SWA_91.speaker: Player
Bird_SWA_91.text: I don't have time for petty bird squabbles.

Bird_SWA_48.speaker: Player
Bird_SWA_48.text: Do you want me to go and deal with the eagles for you?

Bird_SWA_37.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_37.text: Hah! You? Kill an eagle? But if you think you can...
Bird_SWA_37.context: NodeContext: Incredulous, eagles are the scariest things ever for them

Bird_SWA_104.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_104.text: ...then please, please kill the eagles. They're the worst.

Bird_SWA_74.speaker: Player
Bird_SWA_74.text: I'll see what I can do.

Bird_SWA_32.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_32.text: Thank you. I'll keep an eye on the roof. Rude bastards, those eagles. Deserve a little comeuppance.

Bird_SWA_106.speaker: Player
Bird_SWA_106.text: No. I'm not running your errands for you.

Bird_SWA_64.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_64.text: You're not the first to be scared of the eagles, there's no shame in admitting it.

Bird_SWA_39.speaker: Player
Bird_SWA_39.text: You're in luck, the eagles are dead.

Bird_SWA_59.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_59.text: Eagles can be killed? Incredible! Thank you, kind, tall, ugly stranger. My nest awaits.

Bird_SWA_103.speaker: Player
Bird_SWA_103.text: Is that it? No reward for my heroic deed?

Bird_SWA_70.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_70.text: I'm sorry... I'm just a bird. I don't have things to give you. Although...

Bird_SWA_90.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_90.text: When I escaped the eagles, I spotted something buried near that ferry dock. Might be worth a look.

Bird_SWA_95.speaker: Player
Bird_SWA_95.text: What will you do if more eagles return to the roof?

Bird_SWA_24.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_24.text: I'll either be killed or ask another poor sap to fight them again.

Bird_SWA_107.speaker: Player
Bird_SWA_107.text: Try and figure out what these lizards might be.

Bird_SWA_100.speaker: Narrator
Bird_SWA_100.text: *While quite vague, 'drunk lizards' could well point to kobolds, who tend to operate in packs.*

Bird_SWA_60.speaker: Narrator
Bird_SWA_60.text: *Alcoholic lizards didn't show up much in your studies of the natural world.*

Bird_SWA_101.speaker: Player
Bird_SWA_101.text: I'm here to avenge the bird you kicked out. Time to shove off.

Bird_SWA_4.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_4.text: Curses! I was going to ask you to do the same thing, of course that tit got there first!

Bird_SWA_61.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_61.text: Hah, not likely! That bird is long gone, no way you talked to them.

Bird_SWA_5.speaker: Player
Bird_SWA_5.text: Stealing is the art of taking. It's a beautiful thing.

Bird_SWA_20.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_20.text: Well, it feels rubbish. I miss my roof-nest.

Bird_SWA_31.speaker: Player
Bird_SWA_31.text: That's exactly how it works, and it's my turn. Get out, or I'll turn you into stew.

Bird_SWA_89.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_89.text: It's not bloody fair! I got there first! The eagles don't even need it!

Bird_SWA_54.speaker: Player
Bird_SWA_54.text: It's about to get less fair. You have to leave this nest now, or else.

Bird_SWA_42.speaker: Player
Bird_SWA_42.text: Surely the eagles need a nest as much as you?

Bird_SWA_109.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_109.text: Not on top of the monastery, they don't!

Bird_SWA_99.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_99.text: Don't you have anything better to do than bother me?

Bird_SWA_50.speaker: Player
Bird_SWA_50.text: I finished off those eagles for you, the top of the monastery is all yours.

Bird_SWA_79.speaker: Player
Bird_SWA_79.text: I suppose I could turn you into dinner.

Bird_SWA_88.speaker: Blue Jay
Bird_SWA_88.text: No! Not again! I'd only just finished making nest number two!
